name: Metric 1: Onchain Control
about: This metric evaluates whether economically material outcomes are mediated through tokenholder governance, or whether admins, multisigs, security councils, or other privileged roles retain onchain powers that can change the rules or selectively restrict use and exit.
summary: veAERO holders control emissions through epoch-based gauge voting. Core contracts are immutable. An EmergencyCouncil exists for crisis handling. Fee parameters are currently controlled by a Gnosis Safe multisig.

criteria.name: On-chain Governance Workflow
criteria.about: Evaluates whether an onchain process exists that grants tokenholders ultimate authority over protocol decisions.
criteria.notes:
AERO holders lock AERO in VotingEscrow to receive veAERO represented as veNFTs. veAERO holders vote each epoch on gauge weights via the Voter contract. Based on the final vote distribution, the Minter mints weekly AERO emissions, which the Voter distributes to gauges proportionally to votes received.

**EmergencyCouncil:** Exists to handle contingencies. It can be invoked to kill or revive gauges, update pool name and symbol metadata, and rotate the EmergencyCouncil itself.

criteria.name: Role Accountability
criteria.about: Determines whether all privileged or value-impacting roles are governed, revocable, and accountable to tokenholders.
criteria.notes:
veAERO holders indirectly control AERO emissions through epoch-based gauge voting executed by the Voter and Minter.

**EmergencyCouncil:** Exists but is not elected by veAERO holders. It holds limited emergency powers, including killing or reviving gauges and managing pool metadata. This role exists explicitly for crisis handling and sits outside direct tokenholder election.

criteria.name: Protocol Upgrade Authority
criteria.about: Determines whether core protocol logic can be upgraded and whether such upgrades are controlled by tokenholders.
criteria.notes: Core Aerodrome protocol contracts are non-upgradeable and do not use proxy patterns.

criteria.name: Token Upgrade Authority
criteria.about: Assesses whether token behavior can be modified and, if so, whether such changes are controlled by tokenholder governance.
criteria.notes: The AERO token contract is immutable and does not use a proxy pattern. The Minter contract, which is authorized to mint AERO, is also non-upgradeable.

criteria.name: Supply Control
criteria.about: Evaluates whether token supply changes are programmatic or subject exclusively to tokenholder-approved governance processes.
criteria.notes:
AERO minting is fully programmatic and epoch-based (1 epoch = 1 week), enforced by the non-upgradeable Minter contract.

**Emission Rate:** Can be increased/decreased by governance but only in fixed, small, weekly increments of +/-0.01%.

**Growth Emissions:** The protocol separately mints growth emissions for veAERO holders using the formula: weeklyEmissions * (1 - veAERO.totalSupply / AERO.totalSupply)^2 * 0.5. This creates a counter-cyclical incentive where veAERO rewards decrease as more AERO is locked and increase when less AERO is locked.

**Team Emission Rate:** Currently set to 0% of total weekly emissions.

criteria.name: Privileged Access Gating
criteria.about: Assesses whether any bounded actor set can block or selectively restrict economically meaningful protocol actions or exit paths, versus access that is permissionless and symmetric for similarly situated users.
criteria.notes:
**Non-SlipStream:** Fees are set on the PoolFactory which can be changed by the feeManager (set to Gnosis Safe).

**SlipStream:** For CLPoolFactory, fees are set inside the SwapFeeModule which allows feeManager to change fees (currently set to Gnosis Safe).

urls.name: SwapFeeModule: setCustomFee is allowed by CLFactory.swapFeeManager = GnosisSafe

criteria.name: Token Censorship
criteria.about: Examines whether any roles exist that can freeze, blacklist, seize, or otherwise censor token balances or transfers.
criteria.notes:
The AERO token has no blacklist, pause, or seizure mechanisms.

**Team Rate:** The team rate (share of weekly emissions allocated to the team) can be modified by a Gnosis Safe controlled by the Aerodrome team.

**Emission Rate:** Changes to the weekly emission rate (+/-0.01% or unchanged) are controlled by Governor (a multisig), soon to be handed over to governance contracts controlled by veAERO holders.

urls.name: Emission Rate Change By Governor set to different Gnosis Safe

name: Metric 2: Value Accrual
about: This metric evaluates whether the system's operation produces observable, onchain value flows (or token-scarcity effects) that accrue value to tokenholders under rule-based constraints that do not rely on manual transfers, trusted executors, or other unenforced expectations.
summary: veAERO holders receive growth emissions and trading fees from staked LP positions. There is no protocol treasury - all trading fees are distributed. Offchain brand controlled by Aerodrome Foundation.

criteria.name: Accrual Active
criteria.about: Assesses whether value flows to tokenholders are currently active rather than merely theoretical or proposed.
criteria.notes:
**Growth Emissions:** veAERO holders receive rewards from growth emissions (see Supply section). These are transferred to RewardDistributor and veAERO holders can claim in proportion to their ve balance.

**Trading Fees:** For both normal and slipstream (CL) pools, the swap fees meant for LPs who have staked their LP tokens in gauges go to veAERO holders.

urls.name: Gauge Deposit Logic (see earned function as well)
Non-Slipstream: Voter calling Gauge to claim fees
Non-Slipstream: Swap Fee Claimed by Gauge on PoolFees

criteria.name: Treasury Ownership
criteria.about: Determines whether protocol treasury assets are programmatically controlled by tokenholder governance.
criteria.notes: There is no protocol treasury. All trading fees from swapping pools are distributed to veAERO holders and LPs.

criteria.name: Accrual Mechanism Control
criteria.about: Evaluates whether tokenholders can modify parameters governing value capture, such as fees or revenue routing.
criteria.notes:
veAERO holders control:

1. The AERO rewards they receive by locking AERO tokens in VotingEscrow

2. The AERO emissions going into gauges by voting for them in Voter

criteria.name: Offchain Value Accrual
criteria.about: Are there additional offchain value accrual flows that benefit tokenholders?
criteria.notes: Aragon has not verified additional offchain value accrual flows to the AERO token

name: Metric 3: Verifiability
about: This metric measures whether a token's economically material code and deployments are independently verifiable from primary evidence without relying on insider assurances.
summary: AERO token source is publicly available on GitHub and verified on Basescan. Aerodrome protocol contracts are open source and verified.

criteria.name: Token Contract Source Verification
criteria.about: Determines whether the token contract's source code is publicly available and verifiably matches the deployed bytecode.
criteria.notes: The AERO token contract source code (Aero.sol) is publicly available on GitHub and verified on Basescan.

criteria.name: Protocol Component Source Verification
criteria.about: Determines whether core protocol contracts are publicly accessible and verifiable against their onchain deployments.
criteria.notes: Aerodrome protocol contracts (including Slipstream) are open source on GitHub and verified on Basescan.

name: Metric 4: Token Distribution
about: This metric evaluates whether ownership and therefore effective voting power in governance is meaningfully distributed.
summary: Distribution of AERO and veAERO voting power outside of the core team has not been independently verified.

criteria.name: Ownership Concentration
criteria.about: Measures whether a single actor or coordinated group controls a majority of the voting supply.
criteria.notes: Distribution of AERO and veAERO voting power outside of the core team has not been independently verified.

criteria.name: Supply Schedule
criteria.about: Are there known, future events (such as vesting cliffs) that will materially affect the concentration of tokens?
criteria.notes: Aragon has not yet verified the supply schedule criteria for the AERO token

name: Offchain Dependencies
about: Onchain ownership is only one half the story, in many cases. Distribution controls coordination. Even with immutable contracts, the ability to shift users to a fork or new deployment can break the link between existing tokenholders and future activity.
summary: US AERODROME trademark is held by Perpetual Cyclist Services LLC (Delaware). Primary interface terms identify the Aerodrome Foundation as the contracting party.

criteria.name: Brand
criteria.about: Are core trademarks and brand assets owned or controlled by a tokenholder-controlled legal entity?
criteria.notes: A US AERODROME trademark filing lists Perpetual Cyclist Services LLC (Delaware) as the applicant/owner.

criteria.name: Distribution
criteria.about: Are primary domains and distribution assets owned or controlled by a tokenholder-controlled legal entity?
criteria.notes: The primary interface terms identify the Aerodrome Foundation as the contracting party.

criteria.name: Licensing
criteria.about: Is core protocol software/IP (and any associated licensing rights, where applicable) owned or controlled by a tokenholder-controlled legal entity?
criteria.notes: Aragon has not yet verified all the licensing criteria associated with the AERO token or the corresponding protocol and assets
